topic.title: Do chinese people know about ring, a p2p alternative to skype ?
topic.body:
1. on theory the webpage can be open from china https://ring.cx/
1. this p2p app let you make video calls but dont require accounts or require a central server
1. you can call from mobile to pc and from PC to mobile 
1. text messaging is also available



when i say skype i say viber whatsapp hangouts you know spy software

topic.title: freenas is allowed in china ?
topic.body:
can you people go and install freenas 10 ? https://forums.freenas.org/index.php?threads/freenas-10-alpha-is-now-released.38534/ 

the version 10 has IPFS integrated in the plug-in system and on top of that you get all the torrent add-ons

topic.title: do people use jekyll + git to share content in china ?
topic.body:
https://jekyllrb.com/

---

this is a static html generator from markdown (github offer free hosting https://help.github.com/articles/using-jekyll-as-a-static-site-generator-with-github-pages/ ) now the interesting part comes that you can add the rendered html to git 

---

git make sure you that the content is real and nobody changed anything, then the only "problem" is the distribution of files , for example zeronet or IPFS (i recommend IPFS so avoid duplicates) you can do this also via rsync, because git require a RSA key you can be sure that the file are intact

#### notable example of zeronet site doing this 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp

just look at the content.json file http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/content.json

```
},
 "ignore": "(updater/.*|data/.*.db|\\.git.*)",
 "inner_path": "content.json",
 "modified": 1460621028.159847,
 "optional": "(data/poster/.*|js/(?!all.js)|css/(?!all.css))",
 "sign": [
```

topic.title: youtube to IPFS template
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NiTERP3GZaiggN2L3rmgqr3uHeK938e58/

this template is to allow commenting like on youtube, while comments are stored on zeronet the video is stored on IPFS 

the template requires 
1. linux
1. python = https://www.python.org/downloads/
1. pip https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/installing/
1. youtube-dl https://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/download.html
	1. if you have two versions on python use `pip3 install youtube-dl`
	1. there is a youtube-dl for win https://yt-dl.org/latest/youtube-dl.exe but no fucking idea how that works
1. IPFS https://ipfs.io/docs/install/

if you use win10 please install ubuntu bash terminal integration whit win10 please read the news about it
http://www.zdnet.com/article/microsoft-and-canonical-partner-to-bring-ubuntu-to-windows-10/

here is a example of usage 
1. open terminal ( if you use zsh or fish better )
1. run: ipfs daemon
1. clone the template
1. open new terminal
1. cd ..../zeronet/data/1xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx the new cloned template directory (press tab to autocomplete)
1. `youtube-dl -f 18 -o 1.mp4 "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xxxxxx"`
	1. -f 18 = is the medium quality not big file decent  quality
	1. -o 1.mp4= it will save the file whit the name 1.mp4
	1.  "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xxxxxx" the url of the video if you use ZSH you need to put `" " ` in normal bash is not required 
1. ipfs add 1.mp4 = this will put the video on IPFS 
1. the IPFS hash is unique if you look on [this template](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LpGK8nRR5Pxmspm9YGA5mWFAREUvbBBDg/) the song 1.mp4 will give the same hash if you chose to add that into ipfs on your PC this will avoid duplication of files
1. you need to edit the index.html file if you have sublime text installed (note below ) type on terminal `subl index.html` if you are still in that folder 
1. on the line 16 you see ` <source src="https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmbnTDSDJKPNo9aEgHFktLu2KJRD3CNLBhQVYw7hgi61nS" type="video/mp4">Your browser does not support the video tag.</video>` change the hash file to the hash IPFS give you on step 7



note: please install sublime text, this editor can handle very large files, opening 100 MB text file wont make it crash like other text editors

topic.title: template add videos to zeronet and if you want IPFS
topic.body:
1. this assumes you want to add videos from youtube but i can be any video
1. make sure you did read this http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Nse6WcodQ5Mj6ZwvZvuyCVvQESwuxbCUy/?Topic:14_1GtJqyJRsuZhmxVtw5USgvqGbUmVH7EmBD/youtube+to+IPFS+template
1. we are going to use like template http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LpGK8nRR5Pxmspm9YGA5mWFAREUvbBBDg/
1. the IPFS part is explained on the other thread 
1. in order to force a video in  zeronet you need to change content.json
1. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LpGK8nRR5Pxmspm9YGA5mWFAREUvbBBDg/content.json
	1. ` "include": "1.mp4", `
	1. this template is set to load the file  named 1.mp4 so if you name your file 1.mp4 you dont need to change content.json 
1. the file 1.mp4 is on the main folder not sub-folder
1. the template has a default integration whit zeronet blog for comments http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LpGK8nRR5Pxmspm9YGA5mWFAREUvbBBDg/?Post:1:comments

so the usage is 
1. clone the template
1. delete 1.mp4
1. copy paste a new 1.mp4
1. edit the html to fit your needs
1. sing and publish

make sure you get on a PC qube-os + whonix 

https://ipfs.pics/QmUqwGyEpzVe7fjxEcdmPg6fiP7FCPqCi1aJ4Ytvq3qDW1

whonix has two virtual machines 
1 work station 
2 gateway 

you can set any other VM even windows 7 to use the whonix gateway so it can force all connection via tor because that VM works like a network hub

> [p2p](#comment_528_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): thx, what is OP?what's major difference between level 1 and level 2? in other words, what links can be opened in level 2 but not in level 1?

OP = first post, the post that starts the thread 

the major difference from level1 and level2 is the amount of content, level 2 mirrors more content from the website

simple example
level 1 = content from voachinese.com/folder0/folder1/123.html
level 2 = level1+ voachinese.com/folder0/folder1/folder2/456.html

level 3 = level1+ level2+ voachinese.com/folder0/folder1/folder2/folder3/789.html

how to add level 1 to ipfs
1. start ipfs `ipfs daemon`
1.  just go to the zeronet/data folder and `ipfs add 1KYUKi9FBCxEiEwgTVQcr396re3QVnT6en`
1.  `ipfs name publish Q....................................`  so u get the same hash all the time

i forgot to mention because of the way GFW works is important for chinese users to do next:
1. never use optional files, because GFW can terminate TOR connections when you use optional files you need to download the zerosite files every times, w/ no optional files said files need to cross the GFW only 1 times and will be in china forever 
1. use local nodes not proxy, for the reasons said above
